httpserver

Class HTTPRouter

  • java.lang.Object
    • httpserver.HTTPRouter

  • public class HTTPRouter
extends java.lang.Object
    An HTTPRouter is used to route incoming requests to specific handlers.
    See Also:
    HTTPHandler, HTTPRequest

      • HTTPRouter

    • Method Detail

      • route

        public HTTPHandler route(java.lang.String pathSegment,
                HTTPRequest request)
                  throws HTTPException
        Route determines which HTTPHandler to use based on the first path segment (between the first and second `/`).

        If no HTTPHandler can be found for the specified path segment, an error handler is used. You can specify a specific error handler using the setErrorHandler(HTTPHandler) method. The default error handler will send a `501` status code (Not Implemented) to the client.

        Throws:
        HTTPException
        See Also:
        HTTPHandler

      • getHandlers

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,HTTPHandler> getHandlers()
        Get the map used to route paths to specific handlers
        Returns:
        The router's map of path segments and handlers.

      • addHandler

        public void addHandler(java.lang.String pathSegment,
              HTTPHandler handler)
        Add a new route.
        Parameters:
        pathSegment - The first path segment ( between the first and second /) to match
        handler - An HTTPHandler to be routed to.
